title: Partition: Why was British India divided 75 years ago?
description: Britain left India 75 years ago and the country became two separate states, India and Pakistan.

title: The nine-year-old boy who fled war-torn Cyprus for London
description: Baz Bedrossian came to London with his family as a refugee after the second Turkish invasion of Cyprus.

title: MOTD2: Why Chelsea v Tottenham was so controversial
description: Match of the Day 2 pundits Fara Williams and Jermaine Jenas break down some of the controversial moments in the 2-2 draw between Chelsea and Tottenham.

title: Mangrove forests: How 40 million Australian trees died of thirst
description: The mass loss of trees in 2015 provides important lessons for the future, scientists say.

title: Mountain Rescuers called up Ben Nevis for struggling dog
description: Lochaber Mountain Rescue helped Turkish Mountain dog Maggie off the hill when she refused to budge.

title: UK Black Pride event returns to London
description: Mayor of London Sadiq Khan says he is "proud to support" an event that is "more vital than ever".

title: Cats to be freed from special lockdown in German town
description: Owners were ordered to keep their felines indoors to protect an endangered bird.

title: Statue unveiled for boxing great Ken Buchanan
description: The Edinburgh statue honours former undisputed world lightweight champion Ken Buchanan.

title: Egypt fire: Dozens dead in Giza Coptic church
description: The blaze broke out at a Coptic Christian church in the city of Giza causing a stampede.

title: Rower wins European gold after cancer diagnosis
description: Cox Erin Kennedy helps Great Britain to a dominant European Para-rowing gold three months after being diagnosed with breast cancer.

title: UK heatwave: Final day of 'extreme' heat with thunder on way
description: Temperatures will exceed 30C in much of England and Wales - but rain is forecast.

title: Sarah Everard: Vigil protesters no longer face prosecution
description: Six people were accused of breaking lockdown rules by attending the event for Sarah Everard.

title: European Championships: Emotional Erin Kennedy 'proud' after Para-rowing gold
description: Erin Kennedy helps Great Britain claim a dominant European Championships Para-rowing gold three months after being diagnosed with breast cancer.

title: Walrus Freya who became attraction in Norway's Oslo Fjord put down
description: Freya had to be euthanised because the public went too close to her, officials said.

title: Police probe threat to JK Rowling over Salman Rushdie support
description: Police are investigating an online threat to the Harry Potter author after the attack in the US.

title: Channel migrants: More than 20,000 people arrive in UK in 2022
description: Almost double the amount of people have crossed compared to the same period in 2021.

title: Skegness: Body of teenage boy recovered from the sea
description: The boy's body was found after a five-hour search on Saturday.

title: Green spaces across England parched in weekend heatwave
description: Areas that would usually be green and lush are looking wilted and dry as temperatures remain high.

title: Saudi Aramco: Oil giant tops own record with $48.4bn quarterly profit
description: The staggering profit comes amid soaring oil prices in the aftermath of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: 'We are waiting for rain, for winter, for God' - Fighting a megafire in France
description: On the frontline of the wildfires in France is a tactical team trying to stay ahead of the flames.

title: Rhyl: Welsh-only car park ticket machine delays drivers
description: The machines default to Welsh, but users can change that by pressing a "language button".

title: The Papers: Energy cap plans and 'Sanction Iran over Rushdie'
description: Proposals to reduce coming hikes in energy costs and a call by Rishi Sunak for sanctions against Iran's Revolutionary Guard lead the papers

title: Salman Rushdie off ventilator and able to talk
description: The Satanic Verses author was repeatedly stabbed while on stage at a US literary event on Friday.

title: Silence of the Lambs caterpillars turn up in Bridgend garden
description: The insects grow into death's-head hawkmoths, known for their distinctive skull pattern.

title: Brecon walkers pick up 80 dog poos in 90 minutes in town
description: Business owners Lucy Mills and Elen Kelly pick up about one poo a minute on their "poo patrol".

title: Independence Day: The Partition baggage young Indians and Pakistanis carry
description: Seventy five years later, young people on both sides of the border talk about how their history impacts them.

title: The Italian town that celebrates fish and chips
description: The corner of Tuscany where they have been honouring their culinary links to Scotland for decades.

title: Lessons in heartbreak: I coach women to get over their ex
description: A shocking moment in a divorce court prompted Aronke Omame to switch careers and become a break-up coach.

title: Afghanistan: Taliban fire shots to stop Afghan women's Kabul protest
description: Dozens of female protesters in Afghanistan have been on a rare march for their rights in Kabul.

title: Bangladesh fuel prices: 'I might start begging in the street'
description: Inflation and the Ukraine war lead to 50% jump in costs.
